alert.note: Alert for Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 17 at 7:21PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Near Montana Creek and Skaters Cabin. * WHEN...Until 115 AM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in some areas is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 714 PM AKDT, Law enforcement reported heavy rain causing minor flooding near Montana Creek and Skaters Cabin earlier this evening. A few inches of water has been reported flowing over the low water crossing on Montana Creek Road. As of 6 pm, Montana Creek crested just below minor flood stage and is on its way down. Some ponding of water was also reported near Skaters Cabin early Wed evening. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain fell today. Additional rainfall amounts of up to 0.3 inches are possible through the rest of the evening. - Near Montana Creek and Skaters Cabin is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Water levels should recede later this evening. - For Montana Creek at Back Loop Bridge: At 7:00pm the stage was 14.54 feet. Flood Stage is 15.5 feet. Forecast: The Creek crested around 15.2 feet around 5 pm and is currently falling. Water levels expected to continue to drop through the evening. Impacts: At 15.0 feet: At this stage the river is bankfull at the gage and water starts to inundate adjacent undeveloped fields. Water begins flowing over the low water crossing on Montana Creek Road. At 15.5 feet: Flood stage - 3-6 inches of water at low water crossing on Montana Creek Road
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.

area.areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island
